intro: Hieracium lepiduliforme, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Hieracium lepiduliforme is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other sunny, well-drained areas.
